session.name: Liberty Index 2024 - U.S. Senate
session.description: Created by the Republican Liberty Caucus, the 2024 Liberty Index is a liberty-focused legislative scorecard for the U.S. Senate. The Liberty Index scores Republican Senators on 20 pivotal bills/votes from 2024 that either advance liberty or diminish liberty.

bills.title: The Extension of Continuing Appropriations and Other Matters Act
bills.description: The Extension of Continuing Appropriations and Other Matters Act. This continuing resolution funds the federal government from 3/8/24 to 3/22/24, at current spending levels. With $36 trillion in debt, this fiscally irresponsible measure kicks the can down the road without any spending cuts. (Passed House 320-99 on 2/29/24, Passed Senate 77-13 on 2/29/24, Signed by President) The Consolidated Appropriations Act, which appropriates $468 billion in new spending. This bill also funds about 30 percent of the federal government, including the Departments of Justice, Transportation, Energy, Agriculture, Commerce, Interior, Veterans Affairs, Housing and Urban Development, the Environmental Protection

This fiscally irresponsible omnibus bill enables big government to continue wasting taxpayer dollars while treading on our liberties. bills.title: The Further Consolidated Appropriations Act
bills.description: The Further Consolidated Appropriations Act. This $1.2 trillion omnibus bill funds the following federal departments through FY24: Department of Education, Department of Defense, Department of Homeland Security, Department of Labor, Department of Health and Human Services, Department of State, and the Legislative Branch. With $36 trillion in debt, this massive spending bill is fiscally irresponsible. (Passed House 286-134 on 3/22/24, Passed Senate 74-24 on 3/23/24, Signed by President) The Cloture Motion to H.R. 7888 allowed the Senate to bring this bill to the floor for consideration. bills.title: The Continuing Appropriations and Extensions Act
bills.description: The Continuing Appropriations and Extensions Act. This continuing resolution continues to fund the federal government at current spending levels for three months, through 12/20/24.
